meanings.definition: To take hold of suddenly and forcibly
meanings.sent1: The cat was seizing the toy from the shelf.
meanings.sent2: She was seizing the opportunity to learn something new.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was seizing the acorn like it was a precious gem.
meanings.sent4: The storm was seizing the town in its powerful grip.
meanings.sent5: The detective was seizing the suspect before he could escape.
